website_summaries.verdict: Highly recommended by both hobby and professional welders, this helmet has a very comfortable and eyeglass-friendly mask. Automatically darkens with arc light, but still remains clear for welding work.
pros: Darkens by wavelength, not triggered by sunlight
Lens exceptionally clear, easy to see weld puddles
Lens design and blue shade reduce retinal burning
cons: No test button to check darkening speed
Control knobs difficult to reach during use

customer_reviews.title: Great imaging. Five stars
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal welding helmet, superior image quality and face protection. But with a price tag of $300 at the time of purchase, I'd say it's a bit more than you need for a beginner. But if you're already making money hand over fist then go for it, I promise you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: ethan

customer_reviews.title: Best welding helmet ever!
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this helmet for me when I started a new welding project and complained that I could not see out of my old, hobby-type helmet well enough to make a good weld. In the new project, the look of the weld makes a difference. With the new Auto-darkening helmet, I can make a great weld - an no grinding afterward! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cambria's rib

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Only negative is the top part of the head band depth comes loose very easily. The view for mig welding is excellent, even when welding outside in daylight. I've used a $200 Miller helmet for years and this has better vision. Worth the costs.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Gottlieb

customer_reviews.title: No manufacture support for lens failure
customer_reviews.text: The auto lens stopped working and after submitting request for replacement all I have heard is crickets. no manufacturing support.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Jo-An Miner

customer_reviews.title: Christmas wish answered
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it . Thats all he wanted for Christmas. And it is everything he hoped for .
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie

customer_reviews.title: Crappy headgear, great lense
customer_reviews.text: The lense is great but the headgear is not as comfortable as the miller elite and it broke after 4 months of standard shop use.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B.

customer_reviews.title: I am completely satisfy, just in time
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfy, just in time, excellent condition well protected package no issues, truly recommended thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Edgard Rosario Maisonet

customer_reviews.title: I should have gotten this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfortable to wear. Gives a much better view of the weld than the cheap helmet I was previously using. It makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great view thru lens
customer_reviews.text: First 10 minutes in Job the headgear broke. Great view thru lens .Going to send back .Might be good for shop work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good helmet, but only two sensors causes problems.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this helmet for about 3 four years and as most have said, this is a very good helmet in most respects. My only meaningful complaint is the fact it has only two sensors. Most of the time this is not a problem at all, but I will say this becomes a real annoyance when I am in a difficult welding position working within close quarters on an assembly of framing for instance. The sensors become blocked from by the framing and I get flashed over and over again. Is also disappointing the helmet jumped about $50 from my original purchase price, I guess due to demand.
customer_reviews.author: Polobbie

customer_reviews.title: Thinking Miller or Esab or Optrel...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first auto helmet. 1st lens was great for almost 2-3 years. Then it started acting up. The lens would activate was getting lighter/brighter... I was within warranty was shipped a entire new helmet. Then a year later the 2nd started flickering while welding. I let it sit out in the sun, everything the tech said to try. That was replaced... 3rd helmet, remember I only bought one... now it’s acting up again. Flickering like a strobe on off while welding. And getting brighter even though shade is on 13.
customer_reviews.author: Dedmotorhead

customer_reviews.title: Nothing too fancy, just top notch quality lens.
customer_reviews.text: A very simple welding helmet, 3 knobs, delay, shade and sensitivity, no cut or grind mode... however what you pay for is the lens, nothing quite like I’ve tried Miller esab 3m, all the big brands and nothing can top this lens. As mentioned no cut or grind mode so if that is a big factor in your choosing, look elsewhere. Protective lenses are a bit pricey (just like Miller esab etc) however last about 10 times longer than standard protective lenses (more scratch resistant).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
